msIdentifier.repository: Topkapı Palace Museum (Topkapı Sarayı Müzesi) , Istanbul

summary.p: 70 fol.; Writing surface: parchment; Shelfmark: E. H. 2.33; Qurʾānic Text: Q 11:6-12:111; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 110 x 140mm; Script style: kūfī.

This entry is based on the catalogue of Fehmi E. Karatay (1888-1968). Currently we do not have access to the images. With exceptions, the catalogue does not contain precise information on the distribution of the text throughout the pages. For this reason, only fol. 1 is given.

Karatay (1962) describes the manuscripts as follows, p. 22: "63 E. H. 2.33. 12. Cüz. Aharlı esmer kâğıt. 140mm boy ve 110mm eninde 70 yaprak. Sahifede III-IV. (IX-X) asır kûfisi ile ve yaldızla 70mm uzunl.[uğunda] 5 satır. Sonunda Alī b. abī Ṭalib eli ile hicretin 25. yılında yazıldığına dair kayıt var ise de yazı itibariyle III-IV. asırlara ait görünüyor: Y. la da müzehhep levha, sure başları tezhipli, sahife kenarları halkâri. Duraklar ve cetveller yaldız. Kabartına şemseli kırmızı deri cilt. Bu ciltle Hūd (11) suresinin 6. ayetinden Yūsuf (12) suresinin 52. ayetinin sonuna kadar vardır."

This can be translated as follows: "63 E. H. 2.33. The twelfth juzʾ. Sized brown paper. 70 leaves of 140 mm height and 110 mm width. The text area written in Kufic script with gilding of 3rd-4th (9th-10th) century [contains] 5 lines measuring 70 mm. While there is a record suggesting that it was written by the hand of ʿAlī b. abī Ṭālib in the 25th year of Hijra, the manuscript appears to belong to the IIIrd-IVth centuries based on the script: [There is] an illuminated plate in [Leaf] L. 1a, the sūra beginnings are decorated, leaf edges are gilded (halkârî). Verse separators and and the rule-borders are gilded. Red leather binding with embossing mandorla (şemse). The fragment begins with Q 11:6 (Sūra al-Hūd) and ends with the last āyah of Q 12 (Sūra Yūsuf)."
